20101221012925.000|20101221012928.000|CC1|COUNTY, ROAD CREWS CLEANING UP  
20101221012928.000|20101221012928.000|CC1|MUDSLIDES.

20101221012930.000|20101221012931.000|CC1|PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY THIS

20101221012937.000|20101221012939.000|CC1|ONE THIS IS GOOD NEWS FOR ONE   
20101221012939.000|20101221012942.000|CC1|BUSINESS, ROOFERS.              
20101221012942.000|20101221012944.000|CC1|VIKKI VARGAS IN IRVOIN WITH TIPS
20101221012944.000|20101221012950.000|CC1|ON HOW YOU CAN KEEP YOUR HOME   
20101221012950.000|20101221012950.000|CC1|DRY.                            
20101221012950.000|20101221012950.000|CC1|VIKKI.                          
20101221012950.000|20101221012951.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THIS IS            
20101221012951.000|20101221012952.000|CC1|INTERESTING, CHUCK.             
20101221012952.000|20101221012957.000|CC1|THIS WAS BUILT IN THE MID-'70s, 
20101221012957.000|20101221012958.000|CC1|AND EVERY HOMEOWNER HAD THE     
20101221012958.000|20101221013000.000|CC1|OPTION OF PUTTING IN A RAIN     
20101221013000.000|20101221013000.000|CC1|GUTTER.                         
20101221013000.000|20101221013005.000|CC1|IT'S NOT JUST THE OPTION OF     
20101221013005.000|20101221013007.000|CC1|MOVING WATER FROM YOUR ROOF, BUT
20101221013007.000|20101221013009.000|CC1|IT BECOMES A RAIN GAUGE.        
20101221013009.000|20101221013014.000|CC1|THINK OF MICHAEL MARSO AS A     
20101221013014.000|20101221013015.000|CC1|MECHANIC FOR YOUR HOME.         
20101221013015.000|20101221013017.000|CC1|YOUR ROOF SHOULD BE MAINTAINED  
20101221013017.000|20101221013018.000|CC1|JUST LIKE A CAR.                
20101221013018.000|20101221013021.000|CC1|>> THE GUTTERS ARE FULL OF      
20101221013021.000|20101221013021.000|CC1|WATER.                          
20101221013021.000|20101221013023.000|CC1|>> Reporter: MR. GUTTER, AS HE'S
20101221013023.000|20101221013025.000|CC1|KNOWN, HAS SEEN IT ALL FROM TOYS
20101221013025.000|20101221013028.000|CC1|TO TENNIS BALLS.                
20101221013028.000|20101221013034.000|CC1|HE PREFERS TO REMOVE THE        
20101221013034.000|20101221013035.000|CC1|BLOCKAGE BEFORE IT BACKS UP.    
20101221013035.000|20101221013037.000|CC1|>> IT'S IMPORTANT TO KEEP IT UP 
20101221013037.000|20101221013038.000|CC1|I THINK EVERY YEAR THIS PROVES  
20101221013038.000|20101221013040.000|CC1|IT EVEN MORE.                   
20101221013040.000|20101221013042.000|CC1|>> Reporter: HE USES A GUTTER

20101221013046.000|20101221013048.000|CC1|YOU DON'T KEEP YOUR RAIN GUTTERS

20101221014201.000|20101221014203.000|CC1|>>> THESE ARE A NEW TYPE OF     
20101221014203.000|20101221014204.000|CC1|EYEGLASSES CREATED BY A LOCAL   
20101221014204.000|20101221014205.000|CC1|GUY.                            
20101221014205.000|20101221014208.000|CC1|USE THEM FOR READING AND        
20101221014208.000|20101221014209.000|CC1|DISDISTANCE AT THE SAME TIME.   
20101221014209.000|20101221014211.000|CC1|ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS FLIP A    
20101221014211.000|20101221014211.000|CC1|SWITCH.                         
20101221014211.000|20101221014212.000|CC1|>> WOW.                         
20101221014212.000|20101221014214.000|CC1|THAT'S VERY CLEVER, BRUISE.     
20101221014214.000|20101221014216.000|CC1|>> DIDN'T INVENT THEM.          
20101221014216.000|20101221014217.000|CC1|BUT IT IS VERY CLEVER.          
20101221014217.000|20101221014219.000|CC1|A LOT OF PEOPLE DON'T REALIZE,  
20101221014219.000|20101221014221.000|CC1|CHUCK AND COLLEEN, THAT READING 
20101221014221.000|20101221014223.000|CC1|VISION IS DIFFERENT FROM NEAR   
20101221014223.000|20101221014223.000|CC1|VISION.                         
20101221014223.000|20101221014226.000|CC1|IT REQUIRES THE EYE MUSCLES TO  
20101221014226.000|20101221014228.000|CC1|SQUEEZE THE LENS, BUT WE LOSE   
20101221014228.000|20101221014232.000|CC1|THAT ABILITY AT 40 OR 50.       
20101221014232.000|20101221014233.000|CC1|BIFOCALS OR PROGRESSIVES HELP,  
20101221014233.000|20101221014235.000|CC1|BUT YOU HAVE TO MOVE YOUR HEAD  
20101221014235.000|20101221014236.000|CC1|UP OR DOWN.                     
20101221014236.000|20101221014238.000|CC1|THESE GLASSES ARE MORE LIKE OUR 
20101221014238.000|20101221014240.000|CC1|EYES ARE USED TO.               
20101221014240.000|20101221014242.000|CC1|THEY ARE CALLED SUPER FOCUS.    
20101221014242.000|20101221014244.000|CC1|THEY HELP YOU TO SEE FAR AND    
20101221014244.000|20101221014246.000|CC1|NEAR ACCORDING TO THEIR         
20101221014246.000|20101221014248.000|CC1|INVENTORS WITHOUT BIFOCALS,     
20101221014248.000|20101221014250.000|CC1|WITHOUT CHANGING GLASSES FOR    
20101221014250.000|20101221014252.000|CC1|DIFFERENT DISTANCES.            
20101221014252.000|20101221014255.000|CC1|ACTOR JOHN SAXSON SAYS THE OLD  
20101221014255.000|20101221014256.000|CC1|TYPE OF LENSES CAUSED MORE THAN 
20101221014256.000|20101221014259.000|CC1|VISION PROBLEMS FOR HIM.        
20101221014259.000|20101221014301.000|CC1|>> BIFOCALS, GOING UP AND       
20101221014301.000|20101221014304.000|CC1|LOOKING DOWN AND UNTIL I REALLY 
20101221014304.000|20101221014306.000|CC1|SERIOUSLY FELT THAT MY NECK WAS 
20101221014306.000|20101221014306.000|CC1|HURTING.                        
20101221014306.000|20101221014309.000|CC1|>> WHEN JEFF RUSSO TRIED THE NEW
20101221014309.000|20101221014311.000|CC1|GLASSES, HE SAID THEY SOLVED    
20101221014311.000|20101221014312.000|CC1|ANOTHER BIFOCAL PROBLEM.        
20101221014312.000|20101221014315.000|CC1|WITH BIFOCALS HE HAD TO KEEP    
20101221014315.000|20101221014317.000|CC1|MOVING TO FIND THE CLEAREST     
20101221014317.000|20101221014317.000|CC1|SPOT.                           
20101221014317.000|20101221014319.000|CC1|NOT SO WITH THE SUPERFOCUS      
20101221014319.000|20101221014319.000|CC1|LENSES.                         
20101221014319.000|20101221014322.000|CC1|>> I DON'T HAVE TO LOOK FOR A   
20101221014322.000|20101221014323.000|CC1|SWEET SPOT LIKE WOULD YOU WITH  
20101221014323.000|20101221014324.000|CC1|OTHER GLASSES.                  
20101221014324.000|20101221014327.000|CC1|>> SUPER FOCUS GLASSES FOUNDER  
20101221014327.000|20101221014328.000|CC1|SAYS THAT'S BECAUSE HOW THE     
20101221014328.000|20101221014328.000|CC1|LENSES WORK.

20101221014330.000|20101221014331.000|CC1|>> THEY WORK BY CHANGING THE    
20101221014331.000|20101221014334.000|CC1|FOCUS WHEREVER YOU WANT TO LOOK.
20101221014334.000|20101221014336.000|CC1|YOU ADJUST TO SEE CLEARLY.      
20101221014336.000|20101221014338.000|CC1|>> HERE IS HOW MUCH THE GLASSES 
20101221014338.000|20101221014340.000|CC1|ARE MADE OF TWO DIFFERENT       
20101221014340.000|20101221014343.000|CC1|LENSES, SEPARATED BY A THIN FILM
20101221014343.000|20101221014345.000|CC1|OF FLUID THAT ALLOWS THEM TO    
20101221014345.000|20101221014345.000|CC1|SLIDE.                          
20101221014345.000|20101221014348.000|CC1|YOU CHOOSE WHETHER YOU WANT THEM
20101221014348.000|20101221014350.000|CC1|TO WORK FOR NEAR OR FAR VISION
